titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Isidor Schneider Papers
titlestmt.author: Columbia University Libraries. Rare Book and Manuscript Library; machine readable finding aid created by Columbia University Libraries Digital Library Program Division

publicationstmt.publisher:
Rare Book and Manuscript Library
Columbia University Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Machine readable finding aid generated from MARC-AMC source via XSLT conversion June 26, 2009

change.item: Legacy finding aid created from Pro Cite.

did.unittitle: Isidor Schneider Papers,

repository.corpname: Columbia University.Rare Book and Manuscript Library,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Manuscripts and correspondence of Schneider, including numerous manuscripts of short stories and poems, many of which are unpublished, and several full-length manuscripts of unpublished critical works. The collection also contains an extensive file of typescript reports on books for The Book Find Club, clippings of reviews written by Schneider and about his books, photographs and drawings of Schneider, and a file of correspondence relating to his writings. The literary correspondence includes letters from many of the important novelists, poets, and literary critics from the 1920s to the 1950s. They include Conrad Aiken, Sherwood Anderson, Kenneth Burke, Malcolm Cowley, Theodore Dreiser, Waldo Frank, Lillian Hellman, Robert Hillyer, Alfred Kreymborg, Thomas Mann, Arthur Miller, Marianne Moore, Lewis Mumford, Laura Riding, Muriel Rukeyser, Karl Shapiro, Stephen Spender, Mark Van Doren, and Yvor Winters.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into 12 series:

list.item: Series V: Books Relating to Schneider
Series VI: Book Find Club Book Reports
Series VII: Manuscripts by I. Schneider
Series VIII: Books with Contributions by I. Schneider
Series IX: Collected Books and Journals
Series XI: Book Reports for George Braziller
Series XII: Book Reports for George Braziller and Grove Press

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The following boxes are located off-site: 3-22. You will need to request this material from the Rare Book and Manuscript Library at least twenty-four (24) hours in advance to use the collection in the Rare Book and Manuscript Library reading room.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of specific item; Date (if known); Isadore Schneider Papers; Box and Folder; Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Columbia University Library.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. Permission to publish material from the collection must be requested from the Curator of Manuscripts/University Archivist, Rare Book and Manuscript Library (RBML). The RBML approves permission to publish that which it physically owns; the responsibility to secure copyright permission rests with the patron.

did.unittitle: Series II: Inscribed Books
Millen Brand: Savage Sleep; -- Stanley Burnshaw: Early and Late Testament; -- Louis Grudin: The Outer Land and Other Poems; -- Matthew Josephson: Jean-Jaques Rousseau;

The following are all by Norman Rosten: Under the Boardwalk --The Big Road --The Plane and the Shadow --Mister Johnson (based on the novel by Joyce Cary) --Come Slowly, Eden --Thrive Upon the Rock --The Fourth Decade and other Poems --Songs for Patricia --Return Again, Traveler
Series III: Notebook and Manuscripts

The Wall Within:. Uncompleted manuscript of a book on neurosis and art; a project begun under the auspices of the Postgraduate Center for Psychotherapy -- The Functions of Literature: (manuscript of work in progress;) -- Manuscripts, published and unpublished -- Newspaper clipping of various reviews of I. Schneider's work in various periodicals: 1934-36 -- Manuscripts of short stories, including some intended for popular periodicals
Series IV: Manuscript and Reviews

Printed Reviews of I. Schneider's Work -- Reviews by Schneider in, Saturday Review, New Republic, N.Y. Sun, N.Y. Times, N.Y. World and N.Y. Telegram, N.Y. Herald Tribune, N.Y. Post, The Nation, Menorah Journal. -- Other related miscellaneous articles and reviews. -- Unpublished Schneider m.s. The Hand
Series V: Books Relating to Schneider

Farewell to Walden by Florence Becker (inscribed) -- Inky Darling by Louis Grudin (inscribed) -- Poets Gold by David Ross -- Cross Section edited by Edwin Seaver (inscribed) -- The Permanent Goethe edited by Thomas Mann (inscribed) -- Mark Twain: Social Critic by Philip S. Foner (inscribed) -- Man in the Mirror by Aaron Schmuller (inscribed) -- The Autobiography of Emanuel Carnevali compiled by Kay Boyle -- Stefansson Prophet of the North by Earl P. Hanson(inscribed) -- The Spider and the Clock by S. Funaroff (inscribed) -- The Nassau Review (A play about Emily Dickenson)
Series VI: Book Find Club Book Reports
Typed and autograph brief book reports, A - F, Before 1962
Typed and autograph brief book reports, G - N, Before 1962
Typed and autograph brief book reports, A - L, Before 1962 - 1967
Typed and autograph brief book reports, M - Z, Before 1962 - 1967
Series VII: Manuscripts by I. Schneider

The Kingdom of Necessity in the author's hand -- -- An autograph fragment of The Judas Time -- -- Autograph manuscript of unpublished novel: Earth is your Apple (pages 1-51 missing) -- -- Part of an unpublished untitled and unfinished novel, typed

Cross Section 1944 Edited by Edwin Seaver -- -- Cross Section 1945 Edited by Edwin Seaver -- -- The American Caravan Edited by Van Wyck Brooks, Lewis Mumford, Alfred Kreymborg and Paul Rosenfeld -- -- Reader's Digest 1966 Almanac -- -- A Golden Treasury of Jewish Literature Edited by Leo W. Schwarz -- -- The Twin Bedside Anthology (in "His" and "Hers" editions) Edited by Charles Lee -- -- War Poems of the United Nations Edited by Joy Davidman

Jean Reynaud: Encyclopediste de l'epoque Romantique (inscribed), by David Albert Griffiths -- -- A Treasury of Jewish Poetry edited by Nathan and Marynn Ausubel -- -- The Autobiography of Maxim Gorky translated by I. Schneider -- -- A copy of Publisher's Weekly 18 January 1947 containing an article by I. Schneider on the book trade -- -- Caravan IV Edited by Alfred Kreymborg, Lewis mumford and Paul Rosenfeld

Schneider: "Mister Comrad" -- -- Dynamo, A journal of Revolutionary Poetry Summer1934, includes a poem by I. Schneider, "Young Revolutionist;" -- -- Alcestis: A Poetry Quarterly July 1935, Includes I. Housman -- -- The Poeple, Yes By Carl Sandburg -- -- My Childhood by Maxim Gorky, translated by I. Schneider -- -- Vladimir Mayakovsky 1894 - 1930 The American Quarterly on the Soviet Union -- -- The Measure:A Journal of Poetry January 1922, includes "My Street" by I. Schneider -- -- Robert Kaufman (a retrospective on the work of the modern artist, Kaufman, 1913 - 1959) -- -- The Judas Time by I. Schneider -- -- Smoke and Steel by Carl Sandburg -- -- Doctor Transit by I. Schneider with an inscription to his wife, Helen -- -- Comrade Mister poems by I. Schneider, includes m.s poem, typed by I. Schneider -- -- The Temptation of Anthony by I. Schneider

The Experience of Love compiled and edited by I. Schneider -- -- The American Caravan 1927 edited by: Van Wyck Brooks; Lewis Mumford, Alfred Kreymborg and Paul Rosenfeld -- -- American Writers Congress edited by Henry Hart -- -- The Enlightenment: The Culture of the Eighteenth Century edited and introduced by Isidore Schneider -- -- From the Kingdom of Necessity by I. Schneider) -- -- Catholicism edited by George Brantl -- -- Proceso en Diciembre by Emilio Diaz Valcarcel -- -- This Was Radio By Joseph Julian, inscribed to Isidore and Helen Schneider -- -- O'Neill, Son and Playwright by Louis Sheaffer, inscribed to Isidore Schneider -- -- African Sculpture Speaks by Ladislas Segy, inscribed to Isidore Schneider -- -- Marilyn: an Untold Story by Norman Rosten, inscribed to Isidore and Helen Schneider
